item.title: [HBASE-13531] Flakey failures of TestAcidGuarantees#testMobScanAtomicity
item.description: After the merge of master from 4/18/15 with hbase-11339 branch, we encounter some atomicity violations. We want to fix before calling merge to trunk.

Hi Jon, Jonathan Hsieh.
In the CellSkipListSet, the sequenceId is counted in comparing, so different cells with the same row key but different seqId can stay in the same CellSkipListSet.
So I think the violation is caused by the missed readPt when we read cells from MOB files.
Here is the possible scenario, all the cell has the same row key.

  1. A.cell0 is added, its seqId is 0.
  2. A scanner s0 is opend, its readPt is 0, but now start to read this cell0.
  3. Now another cell1 is added, its seqId is 1.
  4. Now memstore is flushed, these two cells are in the same mob file.
  5. The s0 starts to read cell0, and find the mob file.
  6. Seek the row key in the mob file, we don't use the readPt, so the cell1 is found.

I think this can happen. Please advise, Jon.
